No, its very important and nice to include as much info about your torrent as possible.  It is good that NTSC is in the title, but there are several reasons that a person would not download a large file.  These include (in order of priority):

NTSC or PAL (anyone know where to find an excelent converter?!  if we had one, all the movies on TPB could be released in BOTH)
Audio language(s).
Subtitle(s) and are they hard or not? (ie, can you turn them off?)
Video source (ie. quality.  say "shrunk from DVD" or "recorded in a theater" etc.)
Aspect ratio (ie 4X3 or 16X9 etc.)
Audio channels (ie. 5.1 AC3 etc.)

It is not important to write what the movie is about anymore, as this can be easily found on IMDB.  A link to the page is a courtesy, but the above information is a must.
